page.title: 08OIL DEPOT, IPSWICH PORT
page.content: A large area between Landseer Road and the River Orwell, is given over to the bulk storage of liquids and fuels. The company currently operating the site is Powell Duffryn, their major customers being Shell and Conoco. Until recently, most of the liquids (petrol, derv, heavy fuel oil and acids), were brought in by sea-going tankers, up the River Orwell,today however, lorries bring in an increasing amount of products.The company still retain their private jetty along Cliff Quay. As with any bulk storage depot, the view is not beautiful, but nevertheless it is all you would expect of a port complex. It is hidden from residential areas by the slopes of Landseer Park.
